pipeline_state.business_objectives: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.

Session.Abandon\ RedirectWithFlash "customers.asp", "You have been logged out."\ %>\ } ### FILE: includes/orders.asp {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf2867 \cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: Legacy ASP application for managing customer orders, sessions, and authentication, to be modernized into a Node.js application.

convention_profile.summary: The legacy codebase uses VBScript for server-side logic and lacks modern development conventions such as structured error handling and testing.

rules.rule: Use consistent and descriptive names for variables.
Implement structured error handling instead of 'On Error Resume Next'.

lint_recommendations: Refactor to use modern error handling techniques such as try-catch blocks in Node.js.
scaffold_templates: Node.js Express application template with session management and authentication.

health_assessment.summary: The legacy application has low maintainability and lacks modern security and reliability practices.

hotspots.reason: Lack of secure password handling and session management.

risks.title: Insecure Session Management
risks.description: Sessions are managed without secure practices, leading to potential session hijacking.

remediation_backlog.title: Modernize Authentication Component
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: The authentication component uses insecure session management.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Potential for session hijacking and unauthorized access.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Implement secure session management using JWT in Node.js.
success_criteria: Sessions are securely managed using JWT.
Authentication is robust against common vulnerabilities.

agent_results.summary: Analyst requirements pack updated via stage collaboration chat

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, while documenting functionality and acceptance criteria.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase uses ASP and VBScript for session and application management.
The modernization effort targets Node.js, requiring equivalent functionality in a new language.
Backward compatibility and functional parity are critical to ensure existing behaviors are preserved.
The modernization includes architectural design, QA/security checks, and deployment for Docker testing.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: The session and application management in ASP will be mapped to Node.js using Express.js sessions.
The login functionality will be implemented using Node.js middleware for session handling.
Data storage currently using in-memory dictionaries will be transitioned to a more scalable solution like Redis or MongoDB.
The HTML rendering and form handling will be converted to use a templating engine like EJS or Handlebars in Node.js.
clarifications_requested: What specific Node.js frameworks or libraries are preferred for this modernization?
Are there any additional security requirements beyond the existing functionality?
Is there a need to support additional languages or locales in the modernized application?

output.executive_summary: The project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, with deployment readiness for Docker environments.

functional_requirements.title: Application Start
functional_requirements.description: Initialize application settings and session counters on server start.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders'.
Total sessions counter is initialized to 0.
Application settings are accessible across sessions.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage user sessions, including authentication and session counters.
acceptance_criteria: Session starts with 'UserName' set to an empty string and 'IsAuthenticated' set to false.
Session counter increments on session start and decrements on session end.
Flash messages are stored in session and cleared after retrieval.

functional_requirements.title: User Login
functional_requirements.description: Authenticate users based on provided username and manage session state.
acceptance_criteria: User is redirected to 'customers.asp' after login attempt.
Session 'IsAuthenticated' is true and 'UserName' is set if login is successful.
Flash message 'User name is required.' is set if username is empty.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Listing
functional_requirements.description: Display a list of customers from in-memory data.
acceptance_criteria: Customers are listed in a table with ID and Name columns.
User must be logged in to view the customer list.
Redirect to login form if user is not authenticated.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Create new orders with customer selection, status, and total amount.
acceptance_criteria: Order is created with valid customer ID, status, and total amount greater than 0.
Flash message 'Order {id} created.' is displayed on successful creation.
Redirect to 'orders.asp' with error flash message if fields are missing or invalid.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Update existing order status based on user input.
acceptance_criteria: Order status is updated if order ID and new status are valid.
Flash message 'Order {id} updated.' is displayed on successful update.
Redirect to 'orders.asp' with error flash message if order ID is invalid or not found.

functional_requirements.title: Logout Functionality
functional_requirements.description: Terminate user session and redirect to login page.
acceptance_criteria: Session is terminated and all session data is cleared.
User is redirected to 'customers.asp' with a logout flash message.
Flash message 'You have been logged out.' is displayed after logout.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Render HTML pages with dynamic content and session-based navigation.
acceptance_criteria: HTML pages are rendered with dynamic titles and content based on session state.
Navigation links are displayed based on user authentication status.
Flash messages are displayed at the top of the page if present.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application responds to user actions within acceptable time limits.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time for user actions should be under 200ms.
acceptance_criteria: Login and logout actions complete within 200ms.
Customer and order listings load within 200ms.
Order creation and updates complete within 200ms.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure secure handling of user sessions and data.
non_functional_requirements.metric: All user data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
acceptance_criteria: Session data is not exposed in client-side storage.
All data transmissions use HTTPS.
User passwords are hashed and salted.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: Application should support scaling to handle increased user load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Application supports at least 100 concurrent users.
acceptance_criteria: Application maintains performance with 100 concurrent sessions.
Data storage solution supports horizontal scaling.
Load testing demonstrates consistent response times under load.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Application uptime is 99.9% over a 30-day period.
acceptance_criteria: Application recovers from server restarts without data loss.
Session state is preserved across server restarts.
Automated monitoring alerts on downtime.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is user-friendly and accessible.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score of 4.5/5 in usability testing.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is intuitive and easy to navigate.
Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1) are met.
User feedback is positive in usability tests.

side_effects: Add new order to in-memory store
Update order status in in-memory store

assumptions: Node.js and Express.js will be used for server-side implementation.
In-memory data will be transitioned to a persistent storage solution.
Docker will be used for local testing and deployment.

risks.description: Potential data loss during transition from in-memory to persistent storage.
risks.mitigation: Implement data migration strategy and backup existing data.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities due to improper session management.
risks.mitigation: Use secure session handling libraries and enforce HTTPS.

risks.description: Performance degradation with increased user load.
risks.mitigation: Conduct load testing and optimize code for scalability.

risks.description: User dissatisfaction due to changes in user interface.
risks.mitigation: Conduct user testing and gather feedback for UI improvements.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client-side integrations.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and conduct integration testing.

out_of_scope: Support for additional languages beyond English.

intake.business_request_raw: what is the business objective of the legacy code

domain_invariants.statement: Critical business actions must be auditable.
Sensitive data must be masked in logs and responses.

functional.title: Core business flow
functional.description: what is the business objective of the legacy code
acceptance_criteria: Core business flow is captured as executable scenarios.
Inputs, outputs, and side effects are explicitly documented.
Failure modes and validation behavior are defined.

non_functional.title: Auditability
non_functional.description: All critical state changes are traceable to actor, action, and outcome.
acceptance_criteria: Audit event schema is defined.
Critical actions emit audit events.
Evidence links are available for release verification.

non_functional.title: Security controls
non_functional.description: Sensitive data handling follows masking and least-privilege principles.
non_functional.metric: No unmasked sensitive identifiers in logs
acceptance_criteria: Sensitive fields are redacted in logs.
Authorization controls are explicitly defined.
Security test coverage includes critical paths.

vector_context_used.title: Idempotent financial writes
vector_context_used.snippet: Financial write endpoints should require an idempotency key, persist request hash, and return the original response for retried keys with the same payload.

relationships: LegacyInput contract must map deterministically to ModernizedOutput contract

features.title: User Logout

agent_results.summary: Modular-Monolith architecture with 4 services on None

output.architecture_name: Node.js Modernization of Legacy ASP System
output.overview: The system modernizes a legacy ASP application to a Node.js environment using Express.js. It maintains functional parity and backward compatibility with the existing system, leveraging Docker for local deployment and testing.

services.name: Session Management Service
services.responsibility: Handles user sessions, including authentication and session counters.

services.name: Customer Management Service
services.responsibility: Manages customer data and ensures secure access to customer listings.

services.name: Order Management Service
services.responsibility: Handles order creation, updates, and listings.

services.name: HTML Rendering Service
services.responsibility: Renders HTML pages with dynamic content based on session state.

security.encryption: TLS for data in transit, AES-256 for data at rest

auto_scaling_rules: Scale out when CPU usage exceeds 70% for 5 minutes
Scale in when CPU usage drops below 30% for 10 minutes

data_flow.description: User logs in, initiating a session.
Customer data is used to create or update orders.
Order data is rendered into HTML for user display.

latency_optimizations: Use of Redis for session and data caching
Minimize database queries with efficient indexing

trade_offs.rationale: Provides fast in-memory data access and is suitable for session data.
Simplifies deployment and testing while maintaining a clear separation of concerns.
Facilitates local testing and development without cloud dependencies.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy ASP system manages sessions, customer data, and orders using in-memory storage and VBScript for server-side logic.
key_logic_steps: Initialize application settings on server start.
Manage user sessions with authentication and session counters.
Authenticate users and manage session state on login.
Display customer listings and manage access based on authentication.
Create and update orders with in-memory storage.

agent_results.summary: Extracted 8 functional requirements, 5 non-functional requirements, 4 risks, 3 clarifications, 0 failed quality gates [software-general-v1]

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functionality is preserved and documented, with deployment for Docker testing.
requirements_understanding: The legacy code manages customer orders and sessions using ASP.
Modernization involves translating ASP scripts to Node.js with equivalent functionality.
Backward compatibility and functional parity are critical.
Deployment should be Docker-compatible, ensuring local testing is feasible.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Translate VBScript session management to Node.js session handling.
Replace ASP's Application and Session objects with Node.js equivalents.
Implement Node.js Express for HTTP request handling.
Use a Node.js templating engine for HTML rendering.
Ensure data persistence using an in-memory data store or database.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific Node.js frameworks or libraries preferred for this modernization?
Should the modernized application support additional authentication methods?
What specific security checks are required during QA?

output.executive_summary: This project involves modernizing a legacy ASP application to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, with deployment for Docker-based testing.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management in Node.js to track user sessions and authentication status.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are initiated upon user login and terminated on logout.
Session data includes 'UserName', 'IsAuthenticated', and 'FlashMessage'.
Session count is accurately tracked and displayed.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Login
functional_requirements.description: Provide a login mechanism for customers to access the application.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log in with a username; empty usernames are rejected.
Successful login redirects to 'customers' page with a welcome message.
Failed login attempts display an appropriate error message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display a list of customers with their IDs and names.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is retrieved from an in-memory store or database.
Customer list is displayed in a table format.
HTML output is properly encoded to prevent XSS.

functional_requirements.title: Order Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation and update functionalities.
acceptance_criteria: Users can create new orders with valid customer IDs, status, and totals.
Order updates allow status changes with valid order IDs.
Invalid inputs result in appropriate error messages.

functional_requirements.title: Order Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display a list of orders with details and status update options.
acceptance_criteria: Order data is retrieved and displayed in a table format.
Users can update order status directly from the table.
Order totals are formatted as currency.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement a flash messaging system to display temporary messages to users.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after redirects.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages are styled consistently across the application.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Use a templating engine to render HTML pages in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: HTML templates are used for consistent page layout.
Dynamic data is injected into templates securely.
Templates support all legacy page structures.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application can be deployed and tested using Docker.
acceptance_criteria: Dockerfile is provided to build the application image.
Application runs in a Docker container with all dependencies.
Local testing is possible using Docker Compose.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should handle concurrent sessions efficiently.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Support at least 100 concurrent sessions with response time < 200ms.
acceptance_criteria: Load testing shows response times under 200ms for 100 concurrent users.
Session management does not degrade performance under load.
Application scales horizontally with additional instances.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is secure against common web vulnerabilities.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Pass OWASP Top Ten security checks.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes a security audit with no critical vulnerabilities.
Input validation prevents SQL injection and XSS.
Session data is protected against hijacking.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be scalable to accommodate future growth.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Application can scale to 1000 concurrent users with additional resources.
acceptance_criteria: Application architecture supports horizontal scaling.
Load balancer distributes traffic evenly across instances.
Database connections scale with application instances.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure high availability and reliability of the application.
acceptance_criteria: Application includes health checks and monitoring.
Automated failover mechanisms are in place.
Error handling is robust and logs are maintained.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score of 4.5/5 in usability testing.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is consistent and easy to navigate.
Feedback from usability testing is incorporated.
Documentation is provided for end-users.

assumptions: Node.js will be used with Express framework for HTTP handling.
In-memory data store will be replaced with a suitable database in Node.js.
Docker is the preferred method for deployment and testing.

risks.description: Potential data loss during migration from ASP to Node.js.
risks.mitigation: Implement thorough data migration testing and backups.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Conduct regular security audits and code reviews.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient Node.js implementation.
risks.mitigation: Optimize code and conduct performance testing.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client systems.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and provide thorough testing.

out_of_scope: Major changes to the user interface design.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: Node.js will be used with Express framework for HTTP handling.
In-memory data store will be replaced with a suitable database in Node.js.
Docker is the preferred method for deployment and testing.

domain_invariants.statement: Critical business actions must be auditable.

functional.title: API Platform implementation
functional.description: Implement API Platform behavior for: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy fo
acceptance_criteria: API Platform flow is documented with explicit inputs and outputs.

Error handling and audit visibility are defined for this flow.

non_functional.title: Auditability
non_functional.description: All critical state changes are traceable to actor, action, and outcome.
acceptance_criteria: Audit event schema is defined.
Critical actions emit audit events.
Evidence links are available for release verification.

non_functional.title: Security controls
non_functional.description: Sensitive data handling follows masking and least-privilege principles.
non_functional.metric: No unmasked sensitive identifiers in logs
acceptance_criteria: Sensitive fields are redacted in logs.
Authorization controls are explicitly defined.
Security test coverage includes critical paths.

open_questions.question: Are there existing operational constraints or integration dependencies not listed?

quality_gates.name: requirements_completeness
quality_gates.message: At least one functional requirement exists.

quality_gates.name: bdd_presence
quality_gates.message: BDD scenarios are present.

vector_context_used.title: Idempotent financial writes
vector_context_used.snippet: Financial write endpoints should require an idempotency key, persist request hash, and return the original response for retried keys with the same payload.

vector_context_used.title: PII-safe logging
vector_context_used.snippet: Logs must avoid raw personal identifiers. Use central redaction, field allowlists, and explicit data retention windows per tenant policy.

vector_context_used.title: Audit evidence chain
vector_context_used.snippet: Every regulated requirement should map to tests and release evidence. Audit events should include actor, action, timestamp, correlation_id, and outcome.

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

rules.title: Use consistent and descriptive names for variables.
rules.statement: Use consistent and descriptive names for variables.

rules.title: Implement structured error handling instead of 'On Error Resume Next'.
rules.statement: Implement structured error handling instead of 'On Error Resume Next'.

templates.name: Node.js Express application template with session management and authentication.

key_themes: The legacy application has low maintainability and lacks modern security and reliability practices.
summary.recommendation: Prioritize P0/P1 remediation items and enforce convention gates in CI
summary.notes: Generated from SIL health assessment and remediation backlog

findings.title: Hotspot: component:authentication
findings.description: Lack of secure password handling and session management.

findings.title: Insecure Session Management
findings.description: Sessions are managed without secure practices, leading to potential session hijacking.

backlog.title: Modernize Authentication Component
backlog.business_value: Potential for session hijacking and unauthorized access.
plan: Implement secure session management using JWT in Node
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are securely managed using JWT.
Authentication is robust against common vulnerabilities.

architect_output.architecture_name: Node.js Modernization of Legacy ASP System
architect_output.overview: The system modernizes a legacy ASP application to a Node.js environment using Express.js. It maintains functional parity and backward compatibility with the existing system, leveraging Docker for local deployment and testing.

services.name: Session Management Service
services.responsibility: Handles user sessions, including authentication and session counters.

services.name: Customer Management Service
services.responsibility: Manages customer data and ensures secure access to customer listings.

services.name: Order Management Service
services.responsibility: Handles order creation, updates, and listings.

services.name: HTML Rendering Service
services.responsibility: Renders HTML pages with dynamic content based on session state.

security.encryption: TLS for data in transit, AES-256 for data at rest

auto_scaling_rules: Scale out when CPU usage exceeds 70% for 5 minutes
Scale in when CPU usage drops below 30% for 10 minutes

data_flow.description: User logs in, initiating a session.
Customer data is used to create or update orders.
Order data is rendered into HTML for user display.

latency_optimizations: Use of Redis for session and data caching
Minimize database queries with efficient indexing

trade_offs.rationale: Provides fast in-memory data access and is suitable for session data.
Simplifies deployment and testing while maintaining a clear separation of concerns.
Facilitates local testing and development without cloud dependencies.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy ASP system manages sessions, customer data, and orders using in-memory storage and VBScript for server-side logic.
key_logic_steps: Initialize application settings on server start.
Manage user sessions with authentication and session counters.
Authenticate users and manage session state on login.
Display customer listings and manage access based on authentication.
Create and update orders with in-memory storage.

developer_plan.plan_summary: Migrate legacy ASP logic to Node.js using Express.js, maintaining functional parity and modularizing by service responsibilities.

proposed_components.name: Session Management Service
proposed_components.description: Handles user sessions, including authentication and session counters, using Redis for session storage.

proposed_components.name: Customer Management Service
proposed_components.description: Manages customer data and ensures secure access to customer listings, using MongoDB for data storage.

proposed_components.name: Order Management Service
proposed_components.description: Handles order creation, updates, and listings, using MongoDB for data storage.

proposed_components.name: HTML Rendering Service
proposed_components.description: Renders HTML pages with dynamic content based on session state.

chat.message: what is the business objective of the legacy application?

The stage artifact does not provide specific details about the business objective of the legacy application. It only outlines the technical plan for migrating the legacy ASP logic to Node.js using Express.js, focusing on maintaining functional parity and enhancing modularity by dividing the application into distinct services.

To understand the business objective, you would need to refer to additional documentation or stakeholder input that describes the purpose and goals of the legacy application. This typically involves understanding what business processes the application supports, the problems it solves, and the value it provides to users or the organization.

If you have access to business requirements, user stories, or any form of business analysis documentation, reviewing those would help clarify the business objectives. Alternatively, consulting with business analysts, product owners, or stakeholders involved with the legacy application can provide the necessary insights.

Once the business objective is clear, ensure that the migration plan aligns with these goals, maintaining or enhancing the application's ability to meet business needs post-migration.
